summary_short: • Police detained a man at an international airport following a report from a 14-year-old girl alleging he touched her on a plane.

• The man repeatedly denied the accusation, became increasingly argumentative, questioned his detainment, and made personal insults towards officers, including accusations of steroid use and later calling them "fucking perverts" and "condescending assholes."
• He asserted his rights as a "free American," refused to provide ID or comply with instructions, and aggressively confronted officers with profanity, comparing his detention to "Nazi Germany."
• He made a sarcastic comment about having a 'vibrator' in his bag and challenged officers to search it.

• After being handcuffed, the man was arrested for harassment, which he denied, and was later found guilty and sentenced to 30 days in jail, with his sentence stayed on condition of completing a substance abuse program.
entries.summary_detailed: Police responded to an international airport after a plane was diverted due to a 14-year-old girl's report that a man seated next to her had touched her. The man was detained for questioning upon arrival, and throughout the detainment, he repeatedly asked if he could leave, but was informed he was under investigation and could not. He grew increasingly argumentative, denying any wrongdoing, claiming he was being harassed by officers, and making personal comments about their appearance, including accusing one of being on steroids. He also repeatedly requested water. The man stressed that nothing had happened and insisted on his rights as a "free American," refusing to provide identification. His demeanor further escalated as he aggressively confronted an officer, using profanity, personal insults, and accusing the officer of acting like a 'tyrant.' He repeatedly questioned the reason for his continued detention, demanding to leave and claiming he had done nothing wrong, comparing the situation to 'Nazi Germany.' He also refused to sit down when instructed and made a sarcastic comment about having a 'vibrator' in his bag, challenging officers to search it. Eventually, an officer placed the man in handcuffs for safety. The man strongly protested his arrest, asserting he was only exercising his First Amendment rights and alleging that the officers were acting 'above and beyond' due to personal offense. While handcuffed, he continued to insult officers, calling them "fucking perverts" and "condescending assholes," and demanded their names. He was informed he was being arrested for harassment, which he denied. After being escorted to a police vehicle, on-screen text revealed he was found guilty, sentenced to 30 days in jail (with credit for 2 days served), with his sentence stayed on condition of completing a substance abuse program.

timeline.title: Detainment Begins
timeline.note: Man is detained after being accused of touching a 14-year-old girl on a plane.

timeline.title: Refusal to Identify
timeline.note: The man refuses to provide identification to the officers, stating they already have his information.

timeline.title: Escalating Confrontation
timeline.note: The man becomes increasingly agitated, makes personal insults (steroids), repeatedly asks for water, and aggressively confronts officers.

timeline.title: Sarcastic 'Vibrator' Comment
timeline.note: The man sarcastically claims to have a 'vibrator' in his bag and challenges officers to search it.

timeline.title: Man Handcuffed and Protests
timeline.note: An officer places the man in handcuffs for safety, prompting him to protest the arrest citing First Amendment rights.

timeline.title: Continued Argument & Harassment Arrest
timeline.note: The man, in handcuffs, continues to argue and insult officers, and is informed he is being arrested for harassment, which he denies.

timeline.title: Further Insults and Demands
timeline.note: The man calls officers 'fucking perverts' and 'condescending assholes,' demanding their names and badge numbers.

timeline.title: Escorted to Police Vehicle
timeline.note: The man is led to a police vehicle and placed inside.

timeline.title: Legal Outcome Revealed
timeline.note: On-screen text shows he was found guilty, sentenced to jail with a condition for a substance abuse program.

summary_short: • A police captain was stopped by a sergeant for alleged drunk driving in Oklahoma City.
• The captain repeatedly requested the sergeant to turn off his body camera.
• The sergeant refused, citing department policy and his oath to uphold the law without favoritism.
• The captain identified himself as a police captain during the interaction.
• The captain was arrested after failing a field sobriety test and placed on paid administrative leave.
entries.summary_detailed:
This video captures a critical interaction between an Oklahoma City police sergeant and a police captain during what is identified as an alleged drunk driving stop. The scene opens with the sergeant questioning the driver, later revealed to be a police captain, about his alcohol consumption while the captain remains inside his vehicle. Almost immediately, the captain issues a directive to the sergeant, stating, "Turn your camera off." The sergeant, maintaining his professional demeanor, firmly denies this instruction, declaring, "I'm not turning my camera off." He then proceeds to order the captain to step out of the vehicle.

Once outside, the captain reiterates his request, asking the sergeant to "please turn that off." The sergeant, steadfast in his adherence to protocol, again refuses, explicitly citing departmental body camera policy as the reason he cannot comply. He explains that he is aware of the policy and therefore prohibited from deactivating his camera. At this point, the captain identifies himself, stating, "I'm a captain on the police force." The sergeant acknowledges this information but, in turn, reminds the captain of his own rank as a sergeant and his sworn oath to uphold the law without prejudice. He emphatically concludes by declaring his commitment to impartiality: "I don't show favoritism to anyone, regardless. I don't care if you're a gangbanger or the President of the United States." On-screen text provides additional context, indicating that the sergeant initiated the stop due to observing the captain's car swerving. Following this documented exchange, the captain was arrested after reportedly failing a field sobriety test, exhibiting repeated loss of balance. Consequently, the Oklahoma City Police Department has placed the captain on paid administrative leave while the department conducts a thorough investigation into the incident, highlighting the application of professional standards irrespective of rank.

timeline.title: Sergeant asks about alcohol
timeline.note: The sergeant asks the driver, later identified as a captain, how much he had to drink.

timeline.title: Captain requests camera off
timeline.note: The captain instructs the sergeant to 'Turn your camera off.'

timeline.title: Repeated camera request
timeline.note: The captain repeats his request for the camera to be turned off.

timeline.title: Sergeant refuses camera off
timeline.note: The sergeant states, 'I'm not turning my camera off.'

timeline.title: Instruction to exit vehicle
timeline.note: The sergeant tells the captain to 'Go ahead and step out of the vehicle.'

timeline.title: Second camera request outside car
timeline.note: The captain, now outside the vehicle, again asks the sergeant to turn off the camera.

timeline.title: Sergeant explains body cam policy
timeline.note: The sergeant explains he cannot turn off the camera due to body cam policy and his oath.

timeline.title: Captain identifies himself
timeline.note: The captain states, 'I'm a captain on the police force.'

timeline.title: Sergeant emphasizes impartiality
timeline.note: The sergeant reiterates his duty to uphold the law and not show favoritism to anyone.

summary_short: Officers responded to a bar brawl where a bartender was punched after his dog went missing, initiated by Millie's husband over a comment about Donald Trump.
The alleged attacker (husband) was handcuffed, along with initial verbal detentions of a friend and the driver's daughter, as officers interviewed witnesses about the missing dog Louie.
From the patrol car, the handcuffed driver (husband) attempted to negotiate by mentioning knowing police personnel, while women from his group were warned to stay in the vehicle.
Subsequently, two women were arrested for trespassing after refusing to leave, and separate arrests were made for Joshua for battery and Melissa for disorderly intoxication.

Ultimately, the driver was released as his assault victim chose not to press charges, but he was warned against future dishonesty, while Joshua and Melissa were transported to jail for their respective charges.
entries.summary_detailed: The video opens with officers addressing a man in a police car. They were called to a bar fight where a shirtless bartender, holding his dog, explained he was punched after his dog went missing and a group refused to leave. The alleged attacker (Millie's husband, the driver) was handcuffed. The driver's daughter was verbally detained, while officers interviewed Ana about her dog, Louie, and calmed other involved parties. A male witness and the bartender confirmed Millie's husband initiated the fight after a comment about Donald Trump. From inside the police vehicle, the handcuffed driver attempted to negotiate, mentioning his acquaintance with Captain Derek Paul and Sergeant Hager. During this, women from his group were warned to stay in the vehicle, leading to a male officer arresting two women for trespassing after they refused to leave the property. Ultimately, the driver was released as the victim of his assault chose not to press charges, though he was advised not to lie. Concurrently, police processed additional arrests: Joshua was taken to jail for battery, and Melissa, who had been repeatedly warned to leave, was arrested for disorderly intoxication. Officers assisted Melissa with her shirt and counted her $180 cash before transporting both Joshua and Melissa to jail, where they were later seen during processing.

timeline.title: Officers respond to brawl and initial handcuffing
timeline.note: A man is handcuffed for punching the bartender, who explains the fight began over a missing dog.

timeline.title: Initial detentions and interviews
timeline.note: The truck driver's daughter is verbally detained, while officers question Ana about her dog, Louie, and calm other involved parties.

timeline.title: Witness and bartender confirm husband's aggression
timeline.note: Millie is questioned, and both a witness and the bartender state her husband started the fight after a comment about Donald Trump.

timeline.title: Handcuffed driver's negotiation and women's warnings
timeline.note: The man in handcuffs attempts to negotiate with officers, while women from his group are warned to stay in the vehicle.

timeline.title: Two women arrested for trespassing
timeline.note: After being warned to leave, two women are handcuffed and placed in police vehicles for trespassing.

timeline.title: Driver released with warning
timeline.note: The driver is released after his assault victim declines to press charges, but is warned not to lie to officers.

timeline.title: Joshua arrested for battery
timeline.note: Police interact with Joshua regarding his wallet, then he is arrested for battery and taken to jail.

timeline.title: Melissa arrested for disorderly intoxication
timeline.note: Melissa is arrested for disorderly intoxication, searched, and her $180 cash is counted by an officer.

timeline.title: Jail processing for Joshua and Melissa
timeline.note: Both Joshua and Melissa are seen inside the jail during their processing.

summary_short: • A cameraperson confronts an elderly man in a public area for not wearing a face mask.
• The elderly man reacts aggressively, repeatedly attempting to push and hit the cameraperson.
• The cameraperson warns the man that he will call the police for assault and records the altercation.
• A second voice, possibly a mediator or another person, intervenes to de-escalate the situation.
• The elderly man eventually puts on his mask, albeit reluctantly, complaining about difficulty breathing, while being reminded of Singapore's mask mandate and potential legal consequences.
entries.summary_detailed:
The video documents an incident in a public hawker centre or market area where a cameraperson confronts an elderly man for not wearing a face mask. The cameraperson initiates the interaction by stating that he is speaking to the man for his own good and urges him not to be careless, referencing the need to wear a mask. The elderly man, wearing a plaid shirt and shorts, reacts aggressively, repeatedly telling the cameraperson to get out of his way and attempting to push or strike him multiple times with his hands.

The cameraperson maintains his composure while recording, explicitly warning the man that he will call the police if the physical aggression continues. He reiterates that the man's consistent failure to wear a mask in the market area is a recurrent issue and stresses the importance of compliance with the mask mandate. The elderly man responds by stating that he cannot breathe comfortably while wearing a mask and claims the cameraperson is causing him trouble.

Another voice, seemingly a third party, joins the conversation, attempting to mediate. This individual advises the elderly man to simply wear the mask to avoid further complications, emphasizing that everyone is currently facing challenges due to the pandemic. The cameraperson reaffirms that his intention is to ensure the man's well-being and is not meant to be confrontational. The discussion continues with the cameraperson explaining that not wearing a mask is against regulations, and the entire country of Singapore now requires masks in public. The mediator further explains the potential for fines and police involvement if the rules are not followed.

Eventually, after sustained discussion and warnings about legal consequences, the elderly man reluctantly puts on his face mask. He continues to complain about the mask making it difficult to breathe, but he keeps it on, bringing the immediate conflict to a resolution.

timeline.title: Confrontation begins
timeline.note: Cameraperson approaches the elderly man and tells him to wear a mask for his own good.

timeline.title: Elderly man reacts aggressively
timeline.note: The man tells the cameraperson to get out of the way and makes repeated attempts to push or hit him.

timeline.title: Warning about police
timeline.note: Cameraperson warns that he will call the police if the man continues to be aggressive.

timeline.title: Man's physical aggression continues
timeline.note: The man continues to gesture aggressively and attempts to strike the cameraperson, who reiterates the threat of calling the police.

timeline.title: Discussion about mask-wearing
timeline.note: The cameraperson reminds the man that he is not wearing a mask, while the man claims the cameraperson is bothering him.

timeline.title: Man's excuse and repeated non-compliance
timeline.note: The man states he doesn't want to wear a mask. Cameraperson mentions this is a frequent issue.

timeline.title: Mediator intervenes
timeline.note: Another voice attempts to de-escalate, suggesting to avoid fighting and just wear the mask.

timeline.title: Demand to wear mask
timeline.note: Cameraperson insists the man wear the mask first, highlighting the general mask mandate.

timeline.title: Man puts on mask and cameraperson's intent
timeline.note: The elderly man puts on the mask. Cameraperson clarifies he is acting for the man's good, not to target him.

timeline.title: Further de-escalation and man's complaints
timeline.note: The mediator continues to encourage peace. The man complains he cannot breathe with the mask, while wearing it.

timeline.title: Warnings about official action
timeline.note: Cameraperson warns about police reporting the assault and the implications of not wearing a mask in Singapore.

timeline.title: Final exchanges and compliance
timeline.note: Both the cameraperson and mediator emphasize the rules and potential penalties. The elderly man remains compliant with the mask, despite his complaints.

summary_short: • A pedestrian was nearly hit by a Grab Food rider on an e-bike, prompting a confrontation.
• The pedestrian threatened to report the rider to the police due to the dangerous speed on a pathway.
• The Grab Food rider repeatedly apologized, explaining he was trying to earn a living and feared losing his job.
• The pedestrian recounted witnessing another near-miss involving the rider and a young couple.
• After multiple apologies and promises to be more careful, the pedestrian gave the rider a final warning.
entries.summary_detailed:
The video documents a tense confrontation between a pedestrian and a Grab Food rider on an e-bike, initiated after the pedestrian (referred to as 'uncle' by the rider) was almost hit. The incident occurred on what appeared to be a shared pathway, where the rider was moving at a high, dangerous speed. The pedestrian immediately confronted the rider, accusing him of reckless riding and emphasizing that he had almost been hit. He informed the rider of his intention to report the incident to the police station.

The Grab Food rider became visibly distressed, offering repeated apologies and attempting to explain his situation by stating he was 'earning a living.' The pedestrian remained firm, highlighting the extreme danger of the rider's speed on the pathway, mentioning that another couple had narrowly avoided being hit just moments before. He reiterated his intention to proceed with a police report, disregarding the rider's pleas and excuses about his family's reliance on his income. The rider continued to apologize profusely, taking full responsibility for his actions and promising to be more careful in the future.

Ultimately, after the rider's persistent apologies and assurances, the pedestrian decided not to proceed with the report, but issued a stern final warning. The interaction underscored the safety concerns regarding e-bike usage and speed on pedestrian pathways, as well as the pressures faced by delivery riders.

timeline.title: Initial Confrontation
timeline.note: A pedestrian confronts a Grab Food rider on an e-bike, stating he was almost hit.

timeline.title: Threat of Police Report
timeline.note: The pedestrian announces his intention to report the rider to the police station.

timeline.title: Rider's Apology and Explanation
timeline.note: The rider repeatedly apologizes, stating he couldn't see and that he earns a living.

timeline.title: Pedestrian Emphasizes Danger
timeline.note: The pedestrian warns the rider about the danger of hitting other people.

timeline.title: Rider Pleads Against Reporting
timeline.note: The rider pleads with the pedestrian not to report him, reiterating he earns a living.

timeline.title: Near-Miss with Another Couple
timeline.note: The pedestrian recounts seeing the rider almost hit a young couple by one second.

timeline.title: Demand to Go to Police Station
timeline.note: The pedestrian tells the rider to come with him to the police station, calling his riding 'so dangerous'.

timeline.title: Rider's Family Situation
timeline.note: The pedestrian makes a generalized comment about 'rude people', and the rider expresses fear for his family if reported.

timeline.title: Riding on Pathway
timeline.note: The pedestrian points out the rider is not supposed to ride so fast on the pathway, and the rider admits it's his fault.

timeline.title: Rider's Promise to Improve
timeline.note: The rider sincerely apologizes, admits fault, and promises not to repeat the dangerous riding.

timeline.title: Final Warning Issued
timeline.note: The pedestrian gives the rider a chance but warns him, 'You will see you again.'

timeline.title: Reiteration of Near-Misses
timeline.note: The pedestrian reconfirms that the rider didn't hit him but almost hit the young couple, who also looked at the rider in disapproval.

summary_short: • A customer expresses dissatisfaction with a Taco Bell order, claiming it was incorrectly prepared.
• He demands a replacement for the item or an immediate monetary refund.
• Staff members convey difficulty or inability to process the specific refund request.
• The customer becomes increasingly agitated, verbally confronting staff and telling one to leave.
• The video concludes with the customer who was arguing briefly smiling at the camera.
entries.summary_detailed: The video captures a tense interaction at a Taco Bell drive-thru or counter, centered around a customer's dissatisfaction with his order. The incident begins with the customer expressing his desire for a replacement item or a refund, claiming the food was not prepared to his satisfaction, specifically mentioning "one squirt" on the item, implying an ingredient error. A female staff member is heard stating her inability to fulfill the specific request, suggesting a direct refund for an incorrectly made item might not be possible. The person filming, presumably a companion of the customer, reiterates the customer's demand for money back. The conversation continues with the customer insisting on a refund for "one box" of his order. As the exchange progresses, the customer's frustration escalates. He vocally asserts his displeasure, telling the staff to "Don't piss me the f*** off. Move." He then explicitly instructs a male staff member at the counter to "get the f*** out of here." The male staff member is subsequently seen walking away from the service area. Another female staff member is visible in the background of the kitchen, observing the ongoing situation. The video ends as the customer who was arguing turns towards the camera and briefly smiles, just before the recording stops.

timeline.title: Customer demands replacement or refund
timeline.note: A male voice states he wants to come back for a replacement or something different tomorrow.

timeline.title: Staff states inability to fulfill request
timeline.note: A staff member indicates they might not be able to make the requested change.

timeline.title: Customer complains about item preparation
timeline.note: The customer claims the item was "made correctly" but mentions "one squirt" as an issue.

timeline.title: Demand for money back reiterated
timeline.note: The person filming states the customer wants his money back.

timeline.title: Customer specifies refund for one box
timeline.note: The customer clarifies he wants a refund for a single box item.

timeline.title: Customer becomes agitated
timeline.note: The customer tells the staff, "Don't piss me the f*** off. Move."

timeline.title: Refund for one box demand repeated
timeline.note: The customer repeats his request for a refund on one box.

timeline.title: Customer verbally abuses staff
timeline.note: The customer tells a staff member to "get the f*** out of here."

timeline.title: Male staff member walks away
timeline.note: A male staff member walks away from the service counter.

timeline.title: Female staff member observes
timeline.note: A female staff member is seen standing in the kitchen area, observing the situation.

timeline.title: Customer smiles at camera
timeline.note: The customer who was arguing briefly turns towards the camera and smiles.

glossary: Taco Bell Staff (male, told to leave)

summary_short: • A white BMW is observed driving erratically and dangerously within a tunnel.
• The dashcam driver suspects the BMW driver is under the influence of alcohol, repeatedly stating "He's drinking."
• The BMW performs multiple aggressive maneuvers, including swerving sharply, braking unnecessarily, and almost colliding with other vehicles and barriers.
• The dangerous driving continues even after exiting the tunnel, with the BMW swerving from lane to lane.
• The dashcam driver decides to report the incident to the police due to the severity of the dangerous driving.
entries.summary_detailed: The video documents an incident of extremely dangerous driving by a white BMW (license plate SKU8802J) observed by a dashcam-equipped vehicle. The incident begins in a brightly lit tunnel, where the BMW is first seen driving erratically, braking without clear reason, and swerving. The driver of the dashcam vehicle immediately suspects the BMW driver is under the influence of alcohol, repeatedly commenting, "He's drinking, you see" and "He is drinking." The BMW continues its dangerous maneuvers, aggressively swerving to the right lane, nearly causing a collision with another car. The dashcam driver expresses concern, stating, "This one very dangerous." The BMW repeatedly slows down and speeds up, changing lanes abruptly. The dashcam driver contemplates trying to get in front of the BMW to avoid being behind it, but realizes the BMW driver might reciprocate aggressively. As the vehicles exit the tunnel and transition to a normal road, the BMW's erratic driving persists, with it narrowly missing barriers and other vehicles while continuing to swerve across lanes. Observing the sustained dangerous behavior, the dashcam driver concludes, "This one will get into accident, you know." Towards the end of the video, the dashcam driver explicitly states, "I want to call police," a decision which is supported by their passenger.

timeline.title: BMW drives erratically
timeline.note: A white BMW is seen braking and swerving within the tunnel.

timeline.title: Dashcam driver suspects drinking
timeline.note: The dashcam driver comments, "He's drinking, you see. Look at him."

timeline.title: Aggressive swerving
timeline.note: The BMW aggressively swerves to the right, cutting off a vehicle.

timeline.title: Dashcam driver notes danger
timeline.note: The dashcam driver states, "This one very dangerous."

timeline.title: Reiteration of drinking suspicion
timeline.note: The dashcam driver again says, "He is drinking."

timeline.title: Advice to ignore
timeline.note: Someone suggests the dashcam driver should ignore the BMW driver.

timeline.title: Contemplation of action
timeline.note: The dashcam driver considers going in front of the BMW but expects similar aggressive behavior.

timeline.title: BMW swerving after tunnel
timeline.note: After exiting the tunnel, the BMW is still swerving erratically.

timeline.title: Prediction of accident
timeline.note: The dashcam driver predicts, "This one will get into accident, you know."

timeline.title: Decision to call police
timeline.note: The dashcam driver states, "I want to call police," which is affirmed by a passenger.

summary_short: • A female passenger caused a disturbance at an airport gate after missing her flight, yelling at staff and officers and resisting detainment.
• She resisted officers' attempts to detain her, screaming and eventually dropping to the floor, while her sister's request for rebooking was denied by the airline.
• After her arrest, the woman argued with officers in a police vehicle about her restraints and denied aggression, becoming increasingly distressed.
• Her distressed companion was simultaneously informed by an officer that Southwest Airlines would not fly either of them due to the incident.
• The arrested woman continued to plead with officers, citing severe medical concerns, claiming the arrest was unfair and racist, and repeatedly asking for release, a phone call, and water.
entries.summary_detailed: The video opens with airport officers responding to a gate where a female passenger was creating a disturbance after missing her flight. She engaged in a heated confrontation with staff and officers, accusing them of disrespect and resisting attempts to detain her, screaming about her arms and eventually dropping to the floor. Her sister intervened, but the airline refused rebooking due to the passenger's disruptive conduct. Following her arrest, the woman is seen in a police vehicle, arguing about her restraints and denying aggression. Concurrently, her distressed companion is informed by an officer that Southwest Airlines would not fly either of them. The arrested woman continues to express extreme distress in the police car, pleading for release and questioning the arrest, stating she's not aggressive and cannot go to jail for hours as she is not from Tampa. She voices significant medical concerns, including a history of passing out, a racing heart, and lightheadedness, fearing she will pass away and requesting hospital care or water. She calls the arrest 'unbelievable,' 'ridiculous,' and 'racist,' asserting officers handcuffed her without prior discussion, and persistently asks about release, phone calls, and transport home.

timeline.title: Passenger confronts staff and officers
timeline.note: Airport officers arrive as the passenger yells at staff and officers after missing her flight.

timeline.title: Officers attempt detainment
timeline.note: Officers attempt to detain the passenger, who resists, screaming about her arms being hurt.

timeline.title: Sister intervenes for rebooking
timeline.note: The passenger's sister tries to explain the situation and requests rebooking, showing flight details.

timeline.title: Passenger's continued resistance and struggle
timeline.note: The passenger continues to scream and resist officers, eventually dropping to the floor.

timeline.title: Arrested woman argues about restraints
timeline.note: The arrested woman in a police car argues about being searched and the tightness of her restraints, claiming she's not aggressive.

timeline.title: Companion cries about missed flight and arrest
timeline.note: The other woman cries on the phone, explaining they missed their flight and her friend is in jail.

timeline.title: Officer confirms airline refusal
timeline.note: A police officer approaches the crying woman for her ID and states Southwest Airlines won't fly them.

timeline.title: Arrested woman demands answers and expresses distress
timeline.note: The woman in the police car becomes distressed, yelling the situation is 'bogus,' asking about release, a phone call, and how to get home, stating she's not from Tampa.

timeline.title: Woman pleads for help, citing distress and medical concerns
timeline.note: She states she's not aggressive, cries about not going to jail for hours, and claims medical issues like passing out and a racing heart, fearing she'll pass away.

timeline.title: Woman decries arrest as unfair, demands release and support
timeline.note: She calls the arrest 'unbelievable,' 'ridiculous,' and 'racist,' claiming officers handcuffed her without warning, and repeatedly asks about release, a phone call, and getting water.

summary_short: • A woman on an MRT train is captured shouting and making confrontational remarks to other passengers.
• She repeatedly questions the intelligence and attentiveness of those around her, asking "Are you nuts?".
• The woman criticizes a man for using his phone and looking at her while she is speaking.
• She makes general statements about societal change and the behavior of men.
• Other passengers largely remain passive and ignore her outbursts throughout the video.
entries.summary_detailed: The video documents an incident aboard a Singapore MRT train where a woman engages in a heated and confrontational monologue directed at fellow passengers. The footage begins with the woman, identifiable by her glasses, mask pulled down to her chin, and striped pants, standing in the train cabin and shouting agitatedly. As the train doors close, she exclaims, "To Trump, you know!" followed by a repeated "To Trump!" Train announcements for Bishan station and a transfer to the Circle Line are audible amidst her shouts. She then challenges other passengers, questioning, "What is rightful to you?" and rhetorically asking, "Who bring you up? Father and mother!" Her verbal barrage continues as she asks, "Who called the police to catch the person who's trying to fight for you all?" A standard safety announcement about minding the platform gap is heard before she returns to her confrontational tone, repeatedly asking, "Are you nuts, huh? Are you nuts looking at me like that?" She asserts that passengers are looking at her even if they are not listening to music. The camera then shows a male passenger, wearing a white shirt and brown pants, looking at his phone. The woman critiques this behavior, questioning, "What kind of age is this, using a phone? And when I'm talking, you're darting your eyes over me." She observes, "Time has changed. He has never changed," seemingly referencing the man or a broader pattern of male behavior. The video concludes with the woman challenging, "So what now? You go and think. You're a man. Can't expect a woman to think, right?" Throughout the incident, other passengers maintain their composure, appearing to ignore the woman's outbursts.

timeline.title: Woman's Agitated Start
timeline.note: A woman stands in an MRT train, showing signs of agitation and making indistinct exclamations.

timeline.title: Shouting "To Trump!"
timeline.note: The woman shouts the phrase "To Trump, you know!" and then "To Trump!" as the train doors close.

timeline.title: Questions on Rights and Upbringing
timeline.note: Amidst train announcements for Bishan, the woman asks, "What is rightful to you?" and "Who bring you up? Father and mother!"

timeline.title: Police Intervention Query
timeline.note: She questions if the police should be called for someone trying to fight for others.

timeline.title: Platform Gap Announcement
timeline.note: A standard train announcement advises passengers to mind the platform gap.

timeline.title: Accusations of Staring
timeline.note: The woman repeatedly asks, "Are you nuts?" and accuses passengers of looking at her even if not listening to music.

timeline.title: Criticism of Phone Use
timeline.note: She criticizes a man using his phone, stating he is 'darting your eyes over me' while she is talking.

timeline.title: Observations on Change
timeline.note: The woman remarks, "Time has changed. He has never changed."

timeline.title: Challenge to Men's Thinking
timeline.note: She challenges, "You go and think. You're a man. Can't expect a woman to think, right?"

timeline.title: Video End
timeline.note: The video fades out with the woman still speaking, followed by a channel outro.

glossary: MRT: Mass Rapid Transit, the public rapid transit system in Singapore.
Woman: The central figure in the video, seen shouting and making confrontational remarks to other passengers.
Bishan: A specific station on the Singapore MRT network, mentioned in the train announcement.
Circle Line: An MRT line in Singapore, indicated as a transfer option at Bishan station.
Man with phone: A male passenger briefly shown, who the woman criticizes for using his phone and looking at her.
Platform Gap: The space between the train and the station platform, mentioned in a safety announcement.

summary_short: • A motorcyclist navigates heavy traffic on a multi-lane road.
• A young man on a red bicycle is observed weaving dangerously through active car lanes without a helmet.
• At a red light, the motorcyclist confronts the cyclist, advising him on safer riding practices.
• The motorcyclist warns the cyclist about the dangers of his actions and states that he has recorded the incident.
• The cyclist appears dismissive of the safety advice, prompting the motorcyclist to express concern for his life.
entries.summary_detailed:
The video opens from the perspective of a motorcyclist navigating heavy road traffic, marked by frequent honking. A young man on a red bicycle, conspicuous by his lack of a helmet, is seen dangerously weaving through the main lanes occupied by cars, buses, and trucks. The motorcyclist observes this erratic and unsafe cycling behavior as he proceeds through the congested road.

Upon reaching a red traffic light, the motorcyclist pulls alongside the cyclist and initiates a verbal confrontation. He sternly advises the young man that he should not be riding in the main vehicle lanes without a helmet, highlighting the extreme danger of his actions. The motorcyclist instructs the cyclist to use the first lane on the left, closer to the road's edge, as is generally safer and appropriate for cyclists. He explicitly states that he has recorded the entire incident on his camera, implying potential accountability for the unsafe practices.

The cyclist appears to respond with a dismissive gesture or comment, possibly indicating a lack of concern or an intention to continue his current riding style. The motorcyclist, visibly concerned, reiterates his warning, directly telling the cyclist that he risks getting himself killed due to his hazardous cycling in heavy traffic. The interaction concludes with both vehicles and the bicycle remaining stationary at the red light, with the cyclist seemingly unswayed by the safety advice.

timeline.title: Motorcyclist in Traffic
timeline.note: Motorcyclist honks while navigating through heavy road traffic.

timeline.title: Cyclist Weaving Dangerously
timeline.note: A young man on a red bicycle is observed weaving through active car lanes without a helmet.

timeline.title: Following the Cyclist to a Red Light
timeline.note: The motorcyclist continues through traffic, stopping beside the cyclist at a red traffic light.

timeline.title: Verbal Confrontation and Safety Advice
timeline.note: The motorcyclist tells the cyclist he shouldn't be on the road, has no helmet, and should ride on the first lane on the left. He also mentions recording the incident.

timeline.title: Cyclist's Dismissive Response
timeline.note: The cyclist responds dismissively, possibly pointing elsewhere, and the motorcyclist urges him to ride at the side.

timeline.title: Final Warning
timeline.note: The motorcyclist warns the cyclist, 'You're gonna get yourself killed, no?', as traffic remains stopped.

summary_short: • A female taxi driver confronts a male passenger, accusing him of being racist and perverted.
• The passenger denies the accusations, tries to calm the driver, and requests a receipt.
• The driver repeatedly shouts and throws money back at the passenger during the argument.
• The driver claims to have never encountered such a 'pervert customer' in 30 years.
• The driver makes xenophobic remarks, telling 'Chinese like you' to 'go back to China' and accusing them of bullying Singaporeans.
entries.summary_detailed:
The video documents a contentious encounter inside a taxi between a female driver and a male passenger, who is recording the incident. The driver is visibly agitated from the outset, shouting at the passenger. She immediately accuses him of being "racist" and questions his behavior, asking "Why are you doing like this?" The passenger denies scolding her and attempts to de-escalate the situation, asking "Why? I'm not scolding you." He repeatedly requests a receipt for the ride, saying "Print the receipt, okay? Relax. Why are you so angry?"

The driver, however, continues to yell, dismissing his requests and shouting "Complain, complain, complain, you all like to complain!" She then throws something, possibly the money, back at him from the front seat. The passenger clarifies his intent to pay by showing the money again and mentioning "20 dollars," which the driver again rejects by throwing it back. The driver then escalates her verbal assault, calling the passenger a "pervert customer" and asserting he is the "most pervert customer in the world," a statement she claims based on 30 years of driving experience. The confrontation culminates in the driver making xenophobic remarks, telling the passenger that "Chinese like you should go back to China" and accusing them of coming to Singapore to "bully us Singaporeans." The video ends with the driver's derogatory statements, highlighting a severe dispute between the two individuals.

timeline.title: Driver's initial outburst
timeline.note: The female driver shouts, asking the passenger "Why are you very good?" and "Why are you so racist?"

timeline.title: Driver accuses passenger
timeline.note: Driver says "Why are you doing like this?" and "Please don't scold me."

timeline.title: Passenger denies scolding
timeline.note: The passenger calmly responds, "Why? I'm not scolding you."

timeline.title: Driver demands money
timeline.note: Driver says "Okay, give me money," while the passenger states he is not scolding.

timeline.title: Passenger requests receipt
timeline.note: The passenger asks for the "receipt, receipt, receipt" and to "print the receipt."

timeline.title: Passenger tries to calm driver
timeline.note: Passenger suggests, "Relax. Why are you so angry?"

timeline.title: Driver's complaint outburst
timeline.note: The driver shouts "Complain, complain, complain, you all like to complain!" and then throws something.

timeline.title: Money exchange attempt
timeline.note: The passenger attempts to give money, saying "20 dollars," which the driver throws back at him.

timeline.title: Driver labels passenger as 'pervert'
timeline.note: The driver calls the passenger a "pervert customer" and "the most pervert customer in the world," claiming 30 years of experience.

timeline.title: Xenophobic remarks
timeline.note: The driver tells "Chinese like you should go back to China" and accuses them of coming to Singapore to "bully us Singaporeans."

summary_short: • A handicapped man in a motorized wheelchair faced a conflict with an SBS Transit bus driver.
• The passenger accused the driver of being unwilling to deploy the bus ramp for his wheelchair.
• The driver was heard speaking in Chinese, telling someone to 'go quickly' amidst the confrontation.
• The passenger criticized the driver's perceived laziness and asserted his rights as a paying customer.
• He emphasized that handicapped passengers pay the same fare as others and deserve proper service.
entries.summary_detailed:
The video documents an incident on an SBS Transit bus involving a handicapped passenger and the bus driver. The recording begins with the passenger's perspective, capturing a verbal exchange where he asks, "Why?" and questions another person's anger. A voice in the background mentions someone being "aggressive." The filmer then clearly states, "I'm handicapped," indicating his disability is central to the conflict. A female voice, likely the bus driver, is heard speaking in Chinese, uttering phrases like, "I don't know what you want to do, I'm doing it," and repeatedly urging, "Go quickly." 

After a brief exterior view as the bus doors open and close, the camera pans to reveal the filmer, an elderly man wearing a face mask, seated in a motorized wheelchair inside the bus. He proceeds to articulate his frustration in Malay, complaining that if the driver is "lazy" to open the ramp for passengers, she should not be working as a bus driver. He stresses his status as a paying customer, stating that he pays the same fare as anyone else. Transitioning to English, he directly addresses the situation by declaring, "We are paying customers. We are your boss." He reinforces his argument by explaining that handicapped individuals, despite their condition, pay for their rides just like able-bodied passengers and, therefore, expect and deserve respectful and diligent service.

timeline.title: Initial Conflict
timeline.note: A person asks 'Why?' and 'What did he do?', mentioning someone was angry.

timeline.title: Passenger Identifies as Handicapped
timeline.note: The filmer states 'I'm handicapped' and complains about the situation.

timeline.title: Driver Speaks in Chinese
timeline.note: A female voice, possibly the driver, speaks in Chinese about not knowing what to do.

timeline.title: Request to Speak English
timeline.note: A voice requests for English to be spoken.

timeline.title: Bus Horn and Inquiry
timeline.note: The bus horn sounds repeatedly, and the filmer asks 'Nafia, what did he do?'

timeline.title: Handicapped Passenger Visible
timeline.note: The elderly man in a motorized wheelchair is clearly seen inside the bus.

timeline.title: Driver's Unwillingness to Help
timeline.note: The passenger criticizes the driver for being 'lazy' and not opening the ramp.

timeline.title: Paying Customer Statement (Malay)
timeline.note: The passenger emphasizes in Malay that he is a paying customer.

timeline.title: Paying Customer Statement (English)
timeline.note: The passenger asserts in English, 'We are paying customers. We are your boss.'

timeline.title: Call for Equal Service
timeline.note: The passenger argues that handicapped individuals pay the same fare and deserve equal service.

glossary: SBS Transit: A public transport operator in Singapore.
Bus driver: The individual operating the SBS Transit bus, identified as female.
Handicapped man (passenger): The elderly man in a motorized wheelchair who is filming the incident and complaining.
Bus ramp: The mechanism on the bus used to facilitate wheelchair access.
Nafia: A name mentioned by the filmer during the incident, likely referring to another individual present.

summary_short: Airport officers were dispatched to the Delta Sky Lounge due to reports of a woman behaving erratically.
The woman claimed to be on marijuana and anxiety pills, expressing distrust towards American police due to past trauma, and subsequently couldn't pay for a smoking lounge or find her purse.
Officers began escorting the woman from the airport, but she resisted, yelling and refusing to leave the property.
She was subsequently arrested for disorderly conduct and continued to forcefully resist handcuffing and entry into the police car.
Officers eventually secured her in the police vehicle and transported her to a detention facility, despite her ongoing protests and complaints.
entries.summary_detailed: Airport officers are dispatched to the Delta Sky Lounge due to reports of a woman acting erratically. A Delta employee describes the woman's aggressive behavior, including demanding water and yelling about the "British Airways line." The woman, identifying herself as being on marijuana and anxiety pills, expresses distrust towards American police due to past trauma. She agrees to leave the lounge, stating she needs a smoke before her flight to London. After being escorted to a paid smoking lounge, she discovers she doesn't have money to enter, then claims to have left her purse at a non-existent British Airways counter. Subsequently, officers began escorting her out of the airport, but she resisted their instructions, yelling at them and refusing to leave the property. She was then informed she was under arrest for disorderly conduct, leading to a forceful struggle as she resisted handcuffing and repeatedly screamed for help. Officers continued to try and get her into the police car while she complained about pain and mentioned her brother was waiting. After significant resistance, officers managed to physically secure her with a seatbelt in the police vehicle. She continued to protest, referencing being left in the women's toilet and insisting she was a "very good person." Upon being told her flight was gone and she was going to jail, she was driven to a detention facility and escorted inside.

timeline.title: Officers Dispatched
timeline.note: Airport officers sent to Delta Sky Lounge for erratic woman.

timeline.title: Employee Reports Behavior
timeline.note: A Delta employee details the woman's aggressive actions in the lounge.

timeline.title: Woman Located
timeline.note: The officer finds the woman near the bar area of the lounge.

timeline.title: Medication Disclosure
timeline.note: The woman states she is on marijuana and anxiety pills.

timeline.title: Claims Trauma
timeline.note: She expresses being traumatized by American police and refuses to answer questions.

timeline.title: Paid Smoking Lounge
timeline.note: The woman is directed to a smoking lounge that requires a $10 fee but lacks funds.

timeline.title: Missing Purse
timeline.note: The woman claims she left her purse at a non-existent British Airways counter.

timeline.title: Police Escort from Airport
timeline.note: An officer informs the woman she is being escorted out and must leave the property.

timeline.title: Arrest and Resistance
timeline.note: The woman is informed she is under arrest for disorderly conduct and resists handcuffing, yelling for help.

timeline.title: Struggle to Enter Police Car
timeline.note: The woman forcefully resists getting into the police car, complaining of pain.

timeline.title: Secured in Police Car
timeline.note: Officers physically move the woman into the police car and secure her with a seatbelt after further resistance.

timeline.title: Arrival at Jail Facility
timeline.note: The woman is driven to a jail facility and escorted inside, still protesting her arrest.

summary_short: • A long traffic jam forms in an underground car park due to a car unable to exit.
• The driver of the blue car has a monthly car pass that is not working, demanding a $25 fee.
• She cannot pay the fee and the car park company's customer service line is disconnected.
• The intercom operator denies her pass is valid and insists she pays the fee or reverses, despite the traffic.
• Another driver offers to pay for her, but the intercom still requires the payment through the machine, causing further delay.
entries.summary_detailed:
The video opens by showing a significant traffic jam in an underground car park, indicating it has been ongoing for an extended period. The camera focuses on a blue car at the exit barrier, which is causing the delay. The driver of this car, a woman, explains her predicament: her monthly car pass, for which she pays $88, is not functioning, and the machine is demanding a $25 'Assisted Lost Pass Fee'. She doesn't have the required cash on hand and states that she has attempted to contact the car park company's helpline, but it is closed and unresponsive. 

A fellow driver, the person filming, uses the intercom on the parking machine to communicate with remote assistance. He explains the situation, emphasizing the lengthy queue of cars and the woman's monthly membership. However, the intercom operator refutes the woman's claim, stating she does not have a valid membership. The operator insists that the woman must either pay the $25 fee or reverse her vehicle. The person filming highlights the impracticality of reversing due to the extensive traffic jam. He then offers to pay the $25 fee on the woman's behalf to resolve the issue. The intercom operator acknowledges the offer but reiterates that the payment must be made through the machine by the individual exiting, or she could pay for her at the machine. The operator suggests that if her pass is indeed valid but merely un-updated, she would be refunded. The conversation concludes with the woman attempting to explain issues with her pass validation, but she is repeatedly interrupted by the intercom operator, leading to increased frustration.

timeline.title: Traffic Jam Observed
timeline.note: A driver films a long traffic jam in an underground car park, noting the delay.

timeline.title: Focus on Delayed Car
timeline.note: The camera identifies a blue car at the exit barrier as the cause of the hold-up.

timeline.title: Woman Explains Issue
timeline.note: The woman driver states her $88 monthly car pass isn't working, requiring a $25 fee she cannot pay, and the company helpline is closed.

timeline.title: Intercom Activated
timeline.note: The person filming presses the intercom button on the parking machine to seek assistance.

timeline.title: Problem Explained to Intercom
timeline.note: The person filming describes the traffic and the woman's valid membership to the intercom operator.

timeline.title: Intercom Denies Membership
timeline.note: The operator states the woman does not have a valid membership and insists she must pay like everyone else.

timeline.title: Dispute Over Monthly Payment and Contact
timeline.note: The woman reiterates her $88 monthly payment and inability to reach the pass provider, whose number is disconnected.

timeline.title: Intercom Demands Payment or Reversing
timeline.note: The operator insists on payment or reversing, ignoring the traffic jam.

timeline.title: Offer to Pay
timeline.note: The person filming offers to pay the fee if the gate is opened, which the intercom operator agrees to if he pays at the machine.

timeline.title: Final Arguments and Standoff
timeline.note: The person filming confirms he will pay but can't leave his car; the intercom operator persists in demanding payment from the woman, suggesting her pass is old, and the woman tries to explain validation amidst interruptions.
